required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: National Institute of General Medical Sciences (NIGMS)

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will prospectively follow a population of patients with uncontrolled high blood pressure beginning metoprolol succinate therapy to determine the drug effect in an observational clinical trial. The investigators will determine each individual's genotype for both CYP2D6 and Adrenoceptor Beta 1 (ADRB1). Metabolomic markers will be identified to determine if specific metabolites are associated with drug response. The investigators' overall objective is to determine if genetics predicts metoprolol succinate response better than clinical factors such as age, race, body mass index, dose, and medication co-ingestion.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study was terminated due to the change in funding.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Participants with at least a 10% decrease in SBP

secondary_outcome.description: 10 % decline from pre-initiation heart rate will considered a HR decline success. Number of of participants with at least 10% decline is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Drug Events: CYP2D6 Metabolizer Status
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of adverse drug events will be captured and stratified by CYP2D6 metabolizer status (Poor Metabolizer (PM), Extensive Metabolizer (EM), Intermediate Metabolizer (IM), and Ultra rapid Metabolizer).
Occurrence of adverse drug events will be captured and stratified by ADRB1 genotype (strong responder, good responder, non-responder).

other_outcome.description: The top 5 metabolomic factors associated with SBP decline will be captured and stratified by CYP2D6 genotype and phenotype groups.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Metoprolol succinate, CYP2D6 Genotyping, CYP2D6 Phenotyping
arm_group.description: The parent study will integrate covariates to predict metoprolol effectiveness for SBP decline of 10%. All patients will receive metoprolol. The following covariates will be used to predict metoprolol effectiveness: clinical variables (Age, sex, race/ethnicity, co-medications, and BMI) CYP2D6 genotype, CYP2D6 phenotype, and metabolomic factors. metoprolol succinate Genotyping: CYP2D6 only clinically pertinent pathway of metoprolol metabolism and polymorphisms have been associated with altered levels of metoprolol. ADRB1 is the drug target and polymorphism in this receptor has been associated with variable drug response. Genotyping will occur after the treatment phase is complete. CYP2D6 Phenotyping: Phenotype can be discordant from what is predicted by genotype. CYP2D6 henotyping using dextromethorphan will be used. Investigators will be blind to the patient blood pressure outcome for this intervention.

intervention.arm_group_label: Metoprolol succinate, CYP2D6 Genotyping, CYP2D6 Phenotyping

intervention.description: CYP2D6 only clinically pertinent pathway of metoprolol metabolism and polymorphisms have been associated with altered levels of metoprolol. ADRB1 is the drug target and polymorphism in this receptor has been associated with variable drug response. Genotyping will occur after the treatment phase is complete. Thus the investigator, the subject, and the outcomes investigator will be blind to the intervention.
intervention.arm_group_label: Metoprolol succinate, CYP2D6 Genotyping, CYP2D6 Phenotyping

intervention.description: Phenotype can be discordant from what is predicted by genotype due to variability in absorption, hepatic blood flow, drug interaction and drug elimination. These factors can be accounted for by utilizing a phenotyping assay that determines area under the curve of the probe since the probe is affected by the same variables dictating metabolism phenotype of the therapeutic drug. Investigators will be blind to the patient blood pressure outcome for this intervention.
intervention.arm_group_label: Metoprolol succinate, CYP2D6 Genotyping, CYP2D6 Phenotyping

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects between age >30 years and < 80 years
2. Subjects have diagnosis of uncontrolled essential hypertension.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. end stage liver disease,
2. end stage renal disease,
3. pregnant females,
4. American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) classification of >3,
5. wards of the state, prisoners,
6. decisionally challenged,
7. HR<60 bpm,
8. AV block>240 msec,
9. active reactive airway disease,
10. illicit drug abuse in the preceding 30 days,
11. hypersensitivity to metoprolol or its derivatives
12. severe peripheral arterial circulatory disorders.
Subjects will have a screening physical exam performed by Dr. Monte prior to enrollment in the study.

facility.name: University of Colorado Denver; Emergency Department

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 322 participants screen failed or withdrew after consent, but prior to starting the study & receiving the intervention

group.title: Metoprolol Succinate, Genotyping, Clinical Factors, and Phenotyping
group.description: The parent study will integrate covariates to predict metoprolol effectiveness for SBP decline of 10%. All patients will receive metoprolol. The following covariates will be used to predict metoprolol effectiveness: clinical variables (Age, sex, race/ethnicity, co-medications, and BMI) CYP2D6 genotype, CYP2D6 phenotype, and metabolomic factors. metoprolol succinate Genotyping: CYP2D6 only clinically pertinent pathway of metoprolol metabolism and polymorphisms have been associated with altered levels of metoprolol. ADRB1 is the drug target and polymorphism in this receptor has been associated with variable drug response. Genotyping will occur after the treatment phase is complete. CYP2D6 Phenotyping: Phenotype can be discordant from what is predicted by genotype. CYP2D6 henotyping using dextromethorphan will be used. Investigators will be blind to the patient blood pressure outcome for this intervention.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
